title: Change in mass - change in min speed

content.question: The speed <math alttext="v sub minimum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>min</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is the minimum speed necessary for the cart and the load to leave the surface of the hill at the top of the hill. If the load is removed, what is the new minimum speed necessary for the cart to leave the surface of the hill?

choices.label: <math alttext="one fourth v sub minimum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>min</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one half v sub minimum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>min</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
